Package ca.corefacility.bioinformatics.irida.ria.web.projects.metadata

Class ProjectSampleMetadataController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.corefacility.bioinformatics.irida.ria.web.projects.metadata.ProjectSampleMetadataController
  • @Controller
@RequestMapping("/projects/{projectId}/sample-metadata")
public class ProjectSampleMetadataController
extends Object
    This class is designed to be used for bulk actions on MetadataEntry within a Project.

                method=GET)
public String getProjectSamplesMetadataUploadPage​(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                  @PathVariable
                                                  long projectId,
                                                  Principal principal)
        Handle the page request to upload Sample metadata
        Parameters:
        model - Model
        projectId - Long identifier for the current Project
        principal - Principal currently logged in use

      • createProjectSampleMetadata

        @RequestMapping(value="/upload/file",
                method=POST)
@ResponseBody
public SampleMetadataStorage createProjectSampleMetadata​(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                         @PathVariable
                                                         long projectId,
                                                         @RequestParam("file")
                                                         org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
        Upload Excel file containing sample metadata and extract the headers. The file is stored in the session until the column that corresponds to a Sample identifier has been sent.
        Parameters:
        session - HttpSession
        projectId - Long identifier for the current Project
        file - MultipartFile The excel file containing the metadata.
        Returns:
        Map of headers and rows from the excel file for the user to select the header corresponding the Sample identifier.
